1.description: The most formidable witch in Lancre, feared and respected throughout the kingdom. Lives alone in a cottage and practices headology.

4.description: Practices 'headology' - making people believe things will work rather than actual magic. Has strong opinions about proper behavior.

1.description: A cheerful, worldly witch with many children and grandchildren. Lives in a cottage full of cats and enjoys a drink.
The youngest of the three witches, earnest and well-meaning but often confused about proper witching. Believes in crystals and positive thinking.

12.description: Gains confidence and skill throughout her adventures. Shows surprising strength when needed.

1.description: The rightful king of Lancre, murdered by his brother Duke Felmet. Now exists as a ghost, trying to communicate with the living.
The brother who murdered King Verence and usurped the throne. Paranoid and guilt-ridden, constantly washing his hands.
The ambitious wife of Duke Felmet, more ruthless and calculating than her husband. Drives much of the political maneuvering.
The court jester, earnest and kind-hearted but not particularly funny. Wears traditional fool's motley and bells.

12.description: Reveals noble heritage and proves worthy of greater responsibilities. Shows courage when needed.

6.description: A talented young actor with the traveling theater company. Charismatic and natural on stage.

11.description: Reveals royal blood and natural leadership abilities. Born to be a king but chooses the stage.

6.description: A dwarf playwright with the theater company, constantly writing new plays and struggling with inspiration from mysterious sources.
The leader of a traveling theater company. A seasoned actor and manager who raised Tomjon from infancy.

2.description: The anthropomorphic personification of death, speaks in capital letters and has a professional interest in mortality.
Nanny Ogg's eldest son, the village blacksmith. Large and strong but gentle-natured.

1.description: One of Nanny Ogg's sons, serves as a guard at the castle. Earnest but not the brightest.
A castle guard of higher rank, tries to maintain order and discipline among the other guards.
Leader of the castle's military forces, caught between duty and the political situation.
Nanny Ogg's enormous grey tomcat, battle-scarred and aggressive. Rules the local cat population with an iron paw.

6.description: A highly intelligent camel with the theater company, capable of complex mathematical calculations.

3.description: A legendary witch from the past, referenced as an example of what witches used to be like in the old days.

2.description: A castle servant who works in the kitchens and knows all the castle gossip.

3.description: A woman who fancies herself a witch but lacks the real calling. Organizes meetings and committees.

1.description: A deceased witch whose cottage Magrat now occupies. Known for her herb garden and gentle nature.

2.description: The castle gardener who tends the grounds and knows where all the bodies are buried.

A village weaver who makes cloth and clothing for the local community.

3.description: A villager who transports goods with his cart between settlements.

2.description: An elderly village widow who keeps chickens and knows everyone's business.

Ned Simnel's wife who helps manage the farm and household.

3.description: Runs the village tavern where people gather to drink and share news.
Works at the village tavern serving drinks and food to customers.

1.description: Tends to the horses and stables at the castle.

2.description: Prepares meals for the castle inhabitants and manages the kitchen staff.
Works in the castle kitchens cleaning dishes and assisting the cook.

7.description: Handles all the props and set pieces for the theater performances.

A typical resident of the great city of Ankh-Morpork.

7.description: One of the audience members who attends the theater performances.
A prosperous merchant who attends cultural events in the city.

6.description: Sells goods on the streets of Ankh-Morpork.

6.description: Works in the city administration handling official business.
Runs an inn in Ankh-Morpork providing lodging for travelers.

5.description: Deals in buying and selling horses and other livestock.

6.description: Travels around telling stories and legends for entertainment.

4.description: A young woman who hopes to become a witch but lacks natural talent.

Performs juggling acts and acrobatics with the theater troupe.

recaps.1: Three witches witness the murder of the rightful king and receive his infant son to protect, while the usurping duke takes power.
recaps.2: The witches discover the difficulty of caring for a royal baby while the new duke struggles with guilt and paranoia over his crime.
recaps.3: Political tensions rise in Lancre as the duke's rule becomes increasingly unstable and the witches debate their next moves.
recaps.4: The witches use their unique methods to influence events while the duke's mental state deteriorates under the weight of his actions.
recaps.5: A theater company arrives in the area, unknowingly carrying someone important to the kingdom's future as supernatural forces gather.
recaps.6: The witches encounter the traveling players and begin to see how theater might serve their purposes in the greater scheme.
recaps.7: Plans begin to take shape as the witches realize the potential in both the theater and the people they've been protecting.
recaps.8: The supernatural and theatrical worlds collide as the witches orchestrate events to restore proper order to the kingdom.
recaps.9: Dramatic revelations unfold as characters discover their true natures and the witches' long-term plans become clear.
recaps.10: The climax approaches as all the carefully laid plans come together in a spectacular theatrical and magical confrontation.
recaps.11: Royal identities are revealed and choices must be made about duty, destiny, and what kind of life each person truly wants.
recaps.12: The kingdom finds its new equilibrium with rightful rulers in place and the witches having successfully guided fate's hand.
